javadoc:
A simple class for managing the library search path
 and avoiding duplicate directories.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an array of directories to search for libraries
@return an array of directories to search for libraries
methods.name: getLibraryPaths
methods.comment: Returns an array of directories to search for libraries

return.comment: an array of directories to search for libraries

methods.javadoc:
Returns an array of directories to search for libraries
@return a list of directories to search for libraries
methods.name: getLibraryPathsList
methods.comment: Returns an array of directories to search for libraries

return.comment: a list of directories to search for libraries

methods.javadoc:
Sets the directories to search for libraries
@param paths the new library search paths
methods.name: setLibraryPaths
methods.comment: Sets the directories to search for libraries

methods.name: restoreLibraryPaths
methods.comment:
Call this to restore paths that were previously persisted.  If you really need to change
 the paths for the entire JVM, then call #setLibraryPaths(String[]).

methods.name: addPath
methods.comment: Adds the specified path to the end of the path search list.

return.comment: true if the path was appended, false if the path was a duplicate

methods.name: addPathAt
methods.comment: Adds the path at the specified index in path search list.

return.comment: true if the path was appended, false if the path was a duplicate

methods.name: removePath
methods.comment: Removes the path from the path search list.

return.comment: true if the path was removed, false if the path did not exist

methods.javadoc: Resets the library search path to match the system search paths.
methods.name: reset
methods.comment: Resets the library search path to match the system search paths.

name: LibrarySearchPathManager
comment:
A simple class for managing the library search path
 and avoiding duplicate directories.
